result.name: national-diabetes-audit-2020-21-type-1-diabetes
result.notes:
The National Diabetes Audit (NDA) provides a comprehensive view of diabetes care in England and Wales. It measures the effectiveness of type 1 diabetes healthcare against National Institute for Health and Care Excellence (NICE) Clinical Guidelines and NICE Quality Standards.
###Making clinical audit data transparent
In his transparency and open data letter to Cabinet Ministers on 7 July 2011, the Prime Minister made a commitment to make clinical audit data available from the national audits within the National Clinical Audit and Patient Outcomes Programme.
###What information is being made available?
Type 1 diabetes audit data for 2020 to 2021 are available at England and Wales level.
###Using and interpreting the data
Data from the National Diabetes Audit, Type 1 Diabetes Audit should not be looked at in isolation when assessing standards of care.
###Accessing the data
The data are being made available on the data.gov website.
###What does the data cover?
The open data file contains demographics, care processes, treatment targets and insulin pump usage data for the type 1 cohort at CCG/LHB, ICS, Provider, Region and National level.
###What period does the data cover?
The data covers the period 01 January 2020 to 31 March 2021. This National Report was published on 16 June 2022.

organization.name: nhs-digital

organization.description:
NHS Digital is the national provider of information, data and IT systems for health and social care.

It was previously called 'The Health and Social Care Information Centre (HSCIC)'
